sentences.en: Christian faith was the mainspring of Peter’s life.
sentences.cn: 基督教信仰是彼得人生的主要动力。

sentences.en: Fear is the mainspring of war.
sentences.cn: 恐惧是战争的主要动力.

sentences.en: Her jealousy is the mainspring of the novel's plot.
sentences.cn: 这部小说情节中贯穿了她的忌妒之心.

sentences.en: Knowing any man's mainspring of motive you have as it were the key to his will.
sentences.cn: 你要找的正是这种“原动力 ”,它不一定总是某种高尚的或重要的东西.

sentences.en: My life has been music, and a constant search for it has been the mainspring of my life.
sentences.cn: 我以音乐为生，对音乐的不懈探索已经成为我生活的动力。

sentences.en: Small companies are the mainspring of the British economy.
sentences.cn: 小公司是英国经济的主体。

sentences.en: The keepers of the mainspring have little faith in it workings.
sentences.cn: 主要推动力的管理者们对其运转几乎毫无信心.

sentences.en: The mainspring makes the watch motion.
The mainspring of Paul's service is not love for men, but love for Jesus Christ.
sentences.cn: 保罗侍奉的根源不是爱人, 乃是爱主.

sentences.en: The mainspring of the mechanism would remain unchanged.
sentences.cn: 这一机制的主要推动力依然不会改变.

sentences.en: The movements of the wrist make the rotor swing and this winds the mainspring automatically.
sentences.cn: 腕部的运动使得摆锤摇摆,自动使主发条上紧.

sentences.en: You begin to understand what actions were the mainspring of the story.
sentences.cn: 你开始体会到是什么样的行动在推动这个故事的发展。

words.tran_cn: 主要的，最重要的；全力的
主要部分，要点；体力；总管道
支柱；中流砥柱；主要的依靠；主桅支索
主要动力；（钟表）[仪]主发条；主要原因；主要动机

trans.tran_cn: 主体部分，主要影响，（钟表等的）主发条
trans.tran_en: the most important reason or influence that makes something happen
